ygData.messageBody:
Barbed Leggins are off the Dark Elf SK in Befallen.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: RON_TALBOT@...
<RON_TALBOT@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, September 20, 1999 7:59 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Medium Bronze Armor (Spoiler)


From: RON_TALBOT@...

This is rumored to be the case. I am in the exact same position you
are. I am currently wearing a mix of bronze and magical armor. (btw,
where do you get barbed leggings?) I 'think' I noticed a lessening in
the amount of damage I received when I switched to bronze armor from
banded. When I switched the bronze shldr and arms for the ba and bsm
I 'think' I also noticed an increase in damage amounts. This is all
very empirical data. Does anyone know for sure?

Bujold
Xegony


______________________________ Reply Separator

Subject: Re: [eqbards] Medium Bronze Armor (Spoiler)
Author: Non-HP-JasonF (JasonF@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
Date: 9/20/99 4:35 PM


From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>

> They do, however, make a big difference, according to what I've heard.
> Wasn't it on this list where someone said they definately knew that
> different armor types provided different protection, independent of the
> AC value? I remember someone saying a Programmer GM had grabbed him or a
> friend in beta and equipped him in various armor to test this.

I need some clarification on this one!

I've got a bunch of bronze armor stacked up in the bank that I haven't been
wearing because the items that it replaces have magical bonuses (barbed
leggings and barbed arms for a +2 to DEX and to AGI), Bloodstained Mantle,
etc. The weight increase vs. the minimal AC increase has kept me in a mix
of
magic/banded.

Am I to understand that putting on a bunch of bronze for an AC increase of
around 8 or 10 pts is going to make a big big difference in mob damage?

Crier Sharpsong - 23rd bard on fennin ro
